panels.description: Source cluster is not reachable.
panels.title: Unavailable Cluster Links

panels.description:
Total number of active (healthy) mirror topics.
This metric is only reported by the controller
panels.title: Total Mirror Topics

panels.description: Total number of active (healthy) mirror topics.
panels.title: Active Mirror Topics

panels.description: Total number of failed mirror topics; that is, mirroring cannot proceed.
panels.title: Failed Mirror Topics

panels.description: Total number of mirror topics for which mirroring from the source has been paused.
panels.title: Paused Mirror Topics

panels.description: Total number of mirror topics whose mirroring has been temporarily stopped.
panels.title: Pending Stopped Error Mirror Topics

panels.description: Number of dead threads of type ClusterLinkThread, where a dead thread is indicative of an issue with fetching from the source cluster for a partition.
panels.title: Dead Thread Count

panels.description: Number of actively mirrored partitions for which the broker is leader
panels.title: Active Mirror Partitions

panels.description: Number of failed mirror partitions for which the broker is leader. A partition may be in a failed state if the source partitionâ€™s epoch has gone backwards; for example, if the topic was recreated.
panels.title: Failed Mirror Partitions

panels.description: Number of mirrored partitions that are under min ISR.
panels.title: Under Min ISR Mirror Partitions Count

panels.description: Number of mirrored partitions that are under replicated.
panels.title: Under Replicated Partitions Count

panels.description: Number of mirrored partitions that are blocked on fetching data due to issues on the source cluster.
panels.title: Blocked Mirror Source Partitions Count

panels.description: Drill-down of MaxLag, which provides lag in number of messages per replica on the destination cluster from the leader replica on the source cluster. Useful to debug any specific lagging topic partitions/replicas on the destination cluster.
panels.title: Lag per Topic

panels.description: Maximum lag in messages between the replicas on the destination cluster and the leader replica on the source cluster. Provides an indication of overall cluster link health and a relative measure of whether the destination cluster is lagging behind.
panels.title: Lag per Link

panels.description: Drill-down of MaxLag, which provides lag in number of messages per replica on the destination cluster from the leader replica on the source cluster. Useful to debug any specific lagging topic partitions/replicas on the destination cluster.
panels.title: Lag per Broker

panels.description: Rate at which data is fetched from the source cluster. Indicates amount of throughput in bytes per second on the cluster link.
panels.title: Mirroring Throughput

panels.description: Rate at which requests are issued to the source cluster over the cluster link.
panels.title: Mirroring Request Rate

panels.description: Number of bytes per second received from the source cluster and sent to the source cluster.
panels.title: Network Throughput

panels.description: Throttle time metrics may indicate that a cluster link connection is being throttled, which is useful for understanding why lag may be increasing over a cluster link.
panels.title: Throttle time avg

panels.description: Rate per second and total requests issued to the source cluster over the cluster link.
panels.title: Request Rate

panels.description: Average and maximum size in bytes of requests issued to the source cluster over the cluster link.
panels.title: Request Size

panels.description: Rate per second and total number of responses received from the source cluster over the cluster link.
panels.title: Response Rate

panels.description: Number of connections for a cluster link
panels.title: Connection Count

panels.description: Rate per second and total for connections created for the cluster link. If the rate is high, the source cluster may be overloaded with connections.
panels.title: Connection Creation rate

panels.description: Rate per second for connections closed for the cluster link. Can be compared to connection creation to understand the balance of creating/closing connections.
panels.title: Connection Close Rate

panels.description: Statistics of the destination clusterâ€™s network IO for the requests over the cluster link.
panels.title: IO Ratio

panels.description: Statistics of the destination clusterâ€™s network IO for the requests over the cluster link.
panels.title: IO Wait Time Avg

panels.description: Statistics of the destination clusterâ€™s network IO for the requests over the cluster link.
panels.title: IO Wait Time Avg

panels.description: Indicates rate and total network input/output (IO).
panels.title: Network IO Rate

panels.description: Rate per second of cluster link clients authenticating to the source cluster over the cluster link.
panels.title: Successful Authentication rate

panels.description: Average re-authentication latency. Helps to assess whether clients are taking too long to authenticate to the clusters.
panels.title: Re-Authentication Latency avg
Destination cluster Cluster link metadata metrics

panels.description:
Rate per second and total number of times at which the partition count was updated due to source changes.

A high volume or rate of partition count updates might indicate issues on the source cluster.
panels.title: Linked Partitions added rate

panels.description:
Rate per second and total number of consumer offsets committed for a cluster link.

Helps verify if offset migration is happening correctly, a critical metric for failover readiness scenarios.
panels.title: Consumer Offset committed

panels.description:
Rate per second and total number of topic configurations updates due to source topic configuration changes.

Can help troubleshooting and debugging issues where configurations are not propagated.
panels.title: Topic update rate

panels.description: Rate per second and total number of access control lists (ACLs) that are being added for each link.
panels.title: ACL update rate
